bill.summary:
This resolution expresses the sense of the Senate that the economic relationship between the United States and Russia should return to the relationship that existed between such countries before the Russian invasion of Ukraine in 2022, subject to certain conditions.
The resolution also encourages
the President to organize and lead a presidential summit on Eastern European peace and security with the head of the successor government of Russia; the Senate to establish a special, interdisciplinary commission to make recommendations for the reimagination of a post-war, long-term collective security strategy for Europe; and the U.S. government to call on the Russian government to release all political prisoners.
